definition: to invite/to request/to intercept/to solicit/to seek
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request

sentences.english: They’ll make the invitations, hang the decorations, and even serve the food.
sentences.chinese: 他們將會發邀請函，佈置裝飾品，和甚至提供食物。

sentences.english: Does the Saier number invite how many spirit of letter energy?
sentences.chinese: 賽爾號邀請函能的多少個精靈？

sentences.english: The first round of invitations is expected to occur in January 2013.
sentences.chinese: 預計2013年1月方有人首批獲籤邀請函。

sentences.english: Admission to the exhibition will be by invitation only.
sentences.chinese: 只有持邀請函者纔可進入展覽會。
邀請函上說“兩點到七點”。

sentences.english: Instead of working with an expensive invitation company, print your own invitations at home.
sentences.chinese: 在家自己打印邀請函而非找昂貴的打印公司。

sentences.english: My wife Jamie had sent invitations to all our relatives.
sentences.chinese: 我的妻子素咪已經發了邀請函給所有我們的親戚。

sentences.english: Invitations are apparently being extended to your favorite celebrities.
sentences.chinese: 邀請函明顯是你最喜愛名人的擴展。

sentences.english: Letters of invitation may be requested from the JRS Society.
sentences.chinese: 邀請函可能會被要求從JRS遍佈社會。

sentences.english: Special invitation letters and direct mail, exhibitions regularly informed of progress.
sentences.chinese: 特刊與邀請函直郵，定期通報展覽會的進展。

sentences.english: Steadily, Sasa suggests that you will route map printed on the invitation.
sentences.chinese: 穩妥起見，莎莎建議你將行車路線圖印在邀請函上。

sentences.english: Invitation is handwritten. Serena, in cursive.
sentences.chinese: 邀請函使用草體親筆書寫的，塞麗娜。

sentences.english: I've despaired of receiving offer from that company.
sentences.chinese: 我已不抱希望能收到那個公司的邀請函。

sentences.english: A: Good, we'll send him an invitation.
sentences.chinese: 好的，我們會給他一封邀請函。

definition: to present/to give/to hand over/to hand in/to lay before
to fill in a form/to write data in a box (on a questionnaire or web form)
to transmit/to dispatch/to issue (an official document or credential)
to sign (one's name with a pen etc)/to autograph/signature
to sign up/to enter one's name/to apply/to register/to enroll/to enlist
to affix a seal/to stamp (a document)/to sign off on sth
